title: Bridging Physical and Digital Worlds: When Your Body Is Your Tool, Data Becomes Accessible
abstract: New interaction models developed at University of Maryland and University of Manitoba utilize body and hand movement to perform data analysis on large wall-sized displays.
name: proxemiclens

title: Back to the Future: Exploring Multiple Futures in the Stock Market
abstract: A new tool called TimeFork uses interactive graphics and state-of-the-art statistical models to allow traders to investigate multiple parallel universes for predicting the stock market.
name: timefork

title: Survived IEEE VIS 2017 deadline
abstract: Submitted three papers on managing annotations, responsive visualization, and mixed-initiative workflows

title: Visited Gothenburg, Sweden to work with the t2i lab at Chalmers
abstract: Developing a Virtual Reality system that better incorporates real-world aspects

title: Attended IEEE VIS conference in Baltimore, Maryland, USA
abstract: Presented our work on multi-user visual exploration on large displays

title: Returned from a four-month visit to AVIZ group in INRIA, Saclay, France
abstract: Developed a progressive visual analytics system with Jean-Daniel Fekete for Twitter analysis based on natural language processing to understand the underlying topics, sentiments, and conversations

title: Visited Interactive Media Lab in Dresden, Germany
abstract: Started a collaboration with Raimund Dachselt and his team to explore the use of multiple devices for co-located collaborative sensemaking

title: Attended ACM CHI conference in San Jose, California, USA
abstract: Presented our work on interactive prediction of time-series data

title: Attended IEEE VIS conference in Chicago, Illinois, USA
abstract: Presented our work on visualization beyond the desktop

title: Attended HCIC workshop on HCI theories in Pajaro Dunes, California, USA
abstract: My trip was funded by Human-Computer Interaction Consortium (HCIC), an organization consisting of top academic and industrial HCI labs
